newsitem.title: USA: Oregon denies Enron merger hearing request.
newsitem.headline: Oregon denies Enron merger hearing request.

text.p: The Oregon Public Utility Commission (OPUC) has denied Enron Corp's request for a pre-hearing conference on its proposed merger with Portland General Corp, parent of Portland General Electric Co.
A spokesman for the OPUC said Tuesday the administrative law judge (ALJ) reviewing the case otherwise approved a tentative review schedule agreed to during last month's failed settlement talks.
Enron had sought a pre-hearing conference to iron out disagreement over OPUC staff calculations for an electricity rate cut.
The schedule still calls for a report by the OPUC staff on April 11 with comments due April 29.
Oral arguments will be made to the commission May 6 and a final order is due June 4.
"The proceeding should not be changed because a party may not like what the staff recommends to the commission," ALJ Lowell Bergen said in a statement.
The OPUC said Enron recently suggested new dates for future events to occur, but Bergen said he wanted to allow parties an opportunity to provide comments for his review.
